et: Middle English, from Medieval Latin {it}praescribere{/it}, from Latin, to write at the beginning
dt: {bc}to claim a title to something by right of {a_link|prescription}
{bc}to become by prescription invalid or unenforceable
{bc}to lay down as a guide, direction, or rule of action {bc}{sx|ordain||}
{bc}to designate or order the use of as a remedy

dt.t: a {it}prescribed{/it} burn to restore natural forest conditions

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}praescribere{/it} to write at the beginning, dictate, order, from {it}prae-{/it} + {it}scribere{/it} to write {ma}{mat|scribe|}{/ma}
shortdef: to lay down a rule : dictate
to claim a title to something by right of prescription
to write or give medical prescriptions
